title: Can Ethereum Reach $5,000? - The Motley Fool
summary: Ethereum's price has risen 30% this year after a 68% drop in 2022. Some investors hope for huge gains, but the token is still down 68% from its peak. Ethereum reached an all-time high of $4,892 in November 2021, but has since fallen. The bull case for Ethereum includes its potential as a decentralized computing platform, the 1,901 active developers working on it, and the Merge upgrade to a proof-of-stake system. However, there are also reasons to avoid Ethereum, such as technical risks, centralization, and the influence of co-founder Vitalik Buterin. The article concludes that investors should temper expectations for Ethereum to reach $5,000.

title: Ethereum losing streak vs. Bitcoin hits 15 months — Can ETH price reverse course? - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is trading at a 15-month low versus Bitcoin (BTC) and has broken below a critical support level. The ETH/BTC pair dropped to 0.056 BTC, breaking below the 200-week exponential moving average (200-week EMA) near 0.058 BTC. This raises downside risks for the remainder of 2023. Institutional capital flow data also reflects Bitcoin's growing popularity, with Bitcoin-specific investment funds attracting $246 million year-to-date (YTD), while Ethereum funds have lost capital and witnessed outflows worth $104 million in the same period. The discrepancy is likely due to a potential spot Bitcoin exchange-traded product (ETF) approval in the United States and Bitcoin's fourth halving in April 2024, which will reduce the Bitcoin miners' block reward from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Mainnet Shadow Fork Teased Ahead of Dencun - U.Today
summary: Ethereum developers are planning a "shadow hard fork" of the mainnet before the release of the Dencun upgrade. The shadow fork will be conducted after Devnet #10 to test the upgrade, possibly in parallel with testing on public testnets. Developers are still working through "big questions" in the testing process and may not launch Devnet #10 until these questions are answered. The forthcoming Devnet #10 will include a large validator set and new features, and has a 93% participation rate among validators.

title: Is Ethereum at a Crossroads Despite ETH Whales Continuously Accumulating? - ZyCrypto
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is facing a crossroads as it struggles to break above $1,500 despite whales continuing to accumulate more coins. Analyst Ali believes that a close below $1,530 could invalidate the bullish outlook, while $1,530 is a critical demand zone. Meanwhile, Standard Chartered Bank predicts that ETH could reach $8,000 by 2026 due to its dominance in DeFi and NFTs, despite the current bearish market.

title: Ethereum Price Dumps to 7-Month Low, Bitcoin Struggles Below $27K (Market Watch) - CryptoPotato
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Bitcoin (BTC) price has struggled below $27,000, with minor daily price drops leading to a decline in market cap. Ethereum (ETH) hit a 7-month low of $1,550, with other altcoins also experiencing losses. The total crypto market cap has remained relatively stable at around $1.05 trillion.

title: Bitcoin Whales and Ethereum Whales Are Not the Same: Glassnode - Decrypt
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum whales have different holding patterns, according to Glassnode data. Ethereum whales with 1,000+ ETH have seen a sharp downtrend since 2020, while Bitcoin whales have remained mostly flat. However, some experts question the accuracy of the data, citing staking as a possible explanation for the alleged ETH selling. Despite this, both Bitcoin and Ethereum whales remain bullish on the assets.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum worth $1.8 million stolen in a phishing incident on a fake search website - FXStreet
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum worth $1.8 million were stolen in a phishing incident on a fake search website. A user was tricked into sending the cryptocurrencies to a suspected attacker after clicking on a fake imToken url. The attacker received approximately 63 BTC ($1.69 million) and the user's address transferred the remaining 63 BTC ($1.69 million) to another address. This incident highlights the importance of being cautious when searching for phishing links on websites, especially when dealing with financial transactions or sensitive information.

title: Ethereum fees drop drastically – Is low demand the reason? - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum fees have dropped significantly since May, with daily transaction fees reaching their lowest point since April 2020. The decrease is attributed to low demand for NFTs and DeFi activities on the network. The total value locked in DeFi protocols has also declined by 40% since April, and the trading volume of decentralized exchanges has dwindled by 96% since March. As a result, Ethereum's supply has become inflationary, which could put downward pressure on its price.

title: Rising Whale Activity on These Three Ethereum-Based Altcoins a Sign of Potential Bullish Turnaround: Santiment - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Rising whale activity on three Ethereum-based altcoins (dYdX, Ocean Protocol, and Request) may signal a potential bullish turnaround, according to Santiment. Whale activity is increasing, which could indicate a "turnaround becomes much more likely" after a period of price declines. Ethereum is also seeing an uptick in social dominance and old coins moving at a high rate, suggesting increased interest from traders. However, it's important to note that investing in cryptocurrency is high-risk and investors should do their due diligence before making any investment decisions.

title: Dormant Ethereum Whale Sells Millions in ETH on Binance With Massive Profit: Details - U.Today
summary:
Here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

A dormant Ethereum whale awakened and transferred 4,500 ETH (worth $7 million) to Binance, with a profit of $15.56 million. This comes after the whale purchased 11,900 ETH in 2020 for $2.89 million. Other whales have also moved significant amounts of ETH to centralized exchanges, with 59,860 ETH deposited to Coinbase and GateIO. The top 10 Ethereum wallets, both on and off exchanges, have increased their holdings to 8.51% and 39.22 million ETH, respectively.

title: ProShares Is Set To Launch Inverse Ethereum Futures ETF - Crypto Times
summary: ProShares is set to launch an inverse Ethereum futures ETF, called the ProShares Short Ether Strategy ETF (SETH), which aims to profit from potential declines in Ethereum's price. The fund will trade on the NYSE Arca and track the inverse daily performance of the S&P CME Ether Futures Index. This launch comes after ProShares debuted three long-only Ether Futures ETFs in early October and marks the provider's expansion into inverse crypto investment vehicles. The SEC is expected to approve the registration statement on October 15th, with a launch target in early November. ProShares' long Bitcoin futures ETF (BITO) remains the largest, with $850 million in assets under management, while the pending introduction of an inverse Ether product comes as Ethereum hovers near $1,500, down 6% in the past week.
